entities.name: quidditch world cup
entities.description: The Quidditch World Cup is mentioned as an event where wizards are speeding towards.

entities.name: mr. weasley
entities.description: Mr. Weasley is a person who is walking with the narrator and discussing the organizational problem of getting wizards to the Quidditch World Cup without being noticed by Muggles.

entities.name: diagon alley
entities.description: Diagon Alley is mentioned as a place where it would be difficult to pack a hundred thousand wizards.

entities.name: platform nine and three-quarters
entities.description: Platform nine and three-quarters is also mentioned as a place that would be difficult to accommodate a large number of wizards.

relationships.description: The Quidditch World Cup is the destination where Mr. Weasley and the narrator are heading.
Diagon Alley is mentioned as an alternative location that would be difficult to accommodate a large number of wizards, implying it could have been used for the Quidditch World Cup.

Platform nine and three-quarters is also mentioned as an alternative location that would be difficult to accommodate a large number of wizards, implying it could have been used for the Quidditch World Cup.
